
## test

 ```{r}

dat <- read.csv("data_with_dist_effect_1rpP.csv")

t.test.stuff <- function(x,y){
t_test <- t.test(x,y,paired=TRUE,alternative="two.sided")
(t_test)
}

message("t-tests for distance effect")

t.test.single <- t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.FALSE.single,dat$mean_rt.2.FALSE.single)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.FALSE.dual_phon,dat$mean_rt.2.FALSE.dual_phon)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.FALSE.dual_vis,dat$mean_rt.2.FALSE.dual_vis)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.FALSE.dual_rig,dat$mean_rt.2.FALSE.dual_rig)


message("t-tests for rev distance effect")
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.single,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.single)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_phon,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_phon)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_vis,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_vis)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_rig,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_rig)

message("t-tests for rev distance effect group compare")
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.single,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.single)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_phon,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_phon)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_vis,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_vis)
t.test.stuff(dat$mean_rt.1.TRUE.dual_rig,dat$mean_rt.2.TRUE.dual_rig)

#### Rscript -e 'library(rmarkdown); rmarkdown::render("analysis.Rmd", "pdf_document",params = list(filename = "analysis.pdf"))'

```


`r t.test.single`
